<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/24/dow-rises-30000-fresh-record?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dow Hits 29,972
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="arrow breaking thru a wall" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjQwL2Fycm93X2JyZWFraW5nX3RocnVfYV93YWxsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Riding a wave of good vibes, the Dow Jones Industrial Average <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/dow-hits-30000-on-vaccine-progress-biden-transition-idUSKBN2841OS?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rallied</a> past 29,972 points yesterday to a record high. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It also topped 30,000, another completely arbitrary number. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quick refresher on the Dow:</strong> It’s a collection of 30 "blue-chip" U.S. stocks. Blue chip = big, established companies like Microsoft, JPMorgan, Disney, and McDonald's. It’s often criticized for a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/19/markets-101-read-stock-indexes-securities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">funky weighting system</a> and a small sample size (the S&P has more than 500 companies), but the 124-year-old index still holds a symbolic grip over Wall Street. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And that’s exactly how professional investors view the Dow at 30k: symbolic, nothing more. The number could get some individual investors excited, but from a technical POV, it’s <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-dow30000-psychology-analys/analysis-dow-cracks-30000-a-psychological-boost-during-a-pandemic-idUSKBN2842OJ?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just another data point</a> within the broader market rally.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s talk about that rally </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it started: </strong>The Dow was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/global-stock-markets-dow-update-11-24-2020-11606213552?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in the dumps</a> during the onset of the pandemic, trading below 19,000 points in March. Industries such as energy, travel, and banking—all of which are featured prominently in the Dow—were crushed disproportionately due to the lockdowns.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How it’s going: </strong>Those beaten-down industries are enjoying a renaissance thanks to what Bloomberg calls the “<a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-24/back-to-normal-rally-drives-dow-above-30-000-for-first-time?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">back-to-normal</a>” rally. Skyrocketing tech stocks (like Zoom and Peloton) are taking a breather while names like Boeing and AMC are mounting a comeback. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s driving the back-to-normal rally? It’s likely the confluence of several developments: </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>News that an effective vaccine(s) could be rolled out in weeks</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Uncertainty around the election result fading away following President Trump’s legal setbacks </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Expectations that President-elect Joe Biden, and his Treasury Secretary nominee Janet Yellen, will push for more economic stimulus</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The more you know: </strong>The Dow hit 10,000 for the first time in March 1999, and touched 20,000 in January 2017. Of course, each 10,000 point milestone represents a smaller proportional gain, because math. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/24/mccormick-buys-cholula-amid-pandemic-boost-grocery-sales?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
L Catterton Passes the Cholula to McCormick
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Cholula being poured on a taco " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/OtmGEIPc6oZK8/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Cholula being poured on a taco " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/OtmGEIPc6oZK8/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, spice aisle mainstay McCormick decided to do what you do when the eggs come out a little rubbery: add Cholula. It <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/mccormick-nears-deal-to-buy-hot-sauce-maker-cholula-11606188600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed to buy</a> the wood-capped hot sauce company’s parent from private equity firm L Catterton for $800 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">McCormick’s POV: </strong>Cholula will add to a spicy category within the food giant’s slate of offerings. Hot sauce sales in the U.S. are projected to near $1 billion this year, per Euromonitor, approaching ketchup’s throne. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>McCormick has had a buttery, delicious year, with a major shift toward at-home cooking boosting sales of its grocery products, which include French’s mustard, Old Bay seasoning, and Frank’s RedHot. Others in the sector such as Kellogg have also seen higher sales numbers. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>McCormick </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/24/business/cholula-acquisition/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> that with Frank’s and Cholula, it’ll command about 30% of the U.S. hot sauce market. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cholula’s POV: </strong>McCormick said it would help Cholula boost e-comm sales, improve distribution, and strengthen its restaurant biz. DYK? Forty percent of consumers discover Cholula at restaurants. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for Cholula’s previous owner, L Catterton is reportedly expecting a 4x return on its 2019 purchase of Cholula. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/24/covid19-watch-college-students-head-home-holidays?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
College Students Have One More Test to Pass
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As hundreds of thousands of college students trek home for Thanksgiving, public health experts hope Zoom burnout and dirty laundry are all they bring back. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Universities are taking extra precautions:</strong> Many are <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/thanksgiving-coronavirus-campus-university-wisconsin-madison/2020/11/20/9b2c68c0-2a07-11eb-92b7-6ef17b3fe3b4_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ending</a> in-person instruction this week and will wrap the semester up virtually. Some are <a href="https://www.mlive.com/news/ann-arbor/2020/11/university-of-michigan-urges-students-not-to-return-to-campus-for-winter-semester.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">encouraging students</a> to stay home through the extended winter break.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The American College Health Association advised schools with in-person classes after Thanksgiving to ask students to remain on campus.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> A great migration of asymptomatic college students could worsen the U.S.’ Covid-19 caseloads. In the last week, new cases averaged 173,165 per day. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s it mean for spring semester? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many colleges are expected to stick with virtual or hybrid learning, but we could see more human bodies on college campuses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Princeton <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-24/princeton-says-all-undergrads-can-return-to-campus-in-february?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invited</a> all undergrads to campus in January, though most instruction will remain virtual. And the University of Alabama is <a href="https://www.al.com/news/2020/11/university-of-alabama-considers-requiring-all-staff-students-to-return-to-campus-in-january.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">considering</a> requiring all students and staff to return full-time unless they have a medical excuse. </p>

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trying to understand investing today can feel a bit like climbing Mt. Everest—without a Sherpa. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So we teamed up with our friends at <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035515;283728687;z" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fidelity</a> to help guide us—and other young investors out there—on everything from investing trends to economic shifts to the pandemic’s effect on the market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Introducing <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035515;283728687;z" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fresh Invest: What to Know When Investing Today</a>—a limited podcast series hosted by our very own Alex Lieberman, CEO of Morning Brew (you know, the media company behind this here newsletter).  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Each week, Alex and a guest from Fidelity will dig into an <em>oh so fresh </em>topic as it relates to investing today, and answer some of the biggest questions on the minds of young investors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035515;283728687;z" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">In this week’s episode</a>, Alex and Katie Shaw, an analyst and portfolio manager at Fidelity, examine how the rise of e-commerce during the pandemic is shaping the retail sector today, and what you should be keeping track of as you assess the market as an investor. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035515;283728687;z" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tune in right here</a>.</p>

</table>
<img alt="GAP patch sewn by new CEO Sonia Syngal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTUvZ2FwX2luY190dXJuYXJvdW5kLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sifting through Q3 retail earnings felt like a nice walk around the mall circa 2015. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Gap Inc. shares fell over 8% after hours as earnings came in <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/24/gap-gps-reports-q3-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">under expectations</a>. Demand for athleisure and e-commerce boosted sales for Athleta and Old Navy, but that wasn’t enough to offset declines in its namesake and Banana Republic brands.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It was a raging quarter for e-commerce all around. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Abercrombie </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/24/abercrombie-fitch-anf-earnings-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span> a 43% uptick in online sales.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nordstrom’s </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/24/nordstrom-shares-rise-as-retailers-earnings-top-estimates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a></span><span> 54%. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Dick’s e-commerce sales </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/24/dicks-sporting-goods-dks-names-new-ceo-announces-q3-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a></span><span> 95%, while same-store sales grew 23%. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">C-suite shuffle: </strong>The sporting goods chain also dropped major news that its CEO of 36 years, Ed Stack, will transition to executive chairman and current president Lauren Hobart will take his spot. J.Crew also <a href="https://fashionista.com/2020/11/j-crew-appoints-libby-waddle-ceo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">named</a> a new CEO, Madewell chief Libby Wadle, who will replace Jan Singer after just 10 months on the job. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The rest: </strong>RadioShack <a href="https://apnews.com/article/lifestyle-coronavirus-pandemic-42eee6f3d679db0ca78e1e2a41e8108a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has more lives</a> than a cat. A 70% jump in China sales <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/24/tiffany-tif-earnings-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gave Tiffany </a>a jolt of confidence for the holiday quarter. And Best Buy shares <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-24/best-buy-gives-no-outlook-for-holiday-season-after-results-beat?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 7%</a> when the company warned early holiday sales could mean lower demand ahead. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/24/2021-grammys-recording-academy-announces-nominees?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Music Biz in 2020: WAP Stands for We Aren’t Performing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Recording Academy <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/skbaer/2021-grammy-awards-nominations?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> this year’s roster of Grammy nominees. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The highlights: </strong>Obscure indie vocalist Beyoncé notched nine nominations in eight categories, and Taylor Swift scored six. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dua Lipa, former Alabama Shakes frontwoman Brittany Howard, Billie Eilish, Megan Thee Stallion, and DaBaby could also take home some hardware in January. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The snubs:</strong> The Academy <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/24/arts/music/grammy-awards-nominations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still thinks</a> of The Weeknd as Saturday and Sunday, even though the pop star will perform at the Super Bowl. Country star Luke Combs isn’t on the nominee list, either. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Many artists are still scrambling to recover from the broad cancellation of live performances prompted by social distancing restrictions. In the first half of 2020, streaming music grew to 85% of the market by value, compared with 80% the prior year, <a href="http://riaa.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Mid-Year-2020-RIAA-Revenue-Statistics.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per</a> the Recording Industry Association of America. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>.plans for the Jan. 31 ceremony are murky, though we know late-nighter Trevor Noah will host. Producer and Recording Academy chairman Harvey Mason Jr. said the artists will be present and there will be a small audience.</p>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="SpongeBob rainbow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjQzL3Nwb25nZWJvYl9yYWluYm93LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>SpongeBob</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, to celebrate the season of gratitude, we asked you to share the unexpectedly good things that fell into your laps during 2020. We got lots of lovely messages about quality time with family, rediscovered hobbies, and positive career moves. A few of our favorites: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Working from home almost 100% has provided me the opportunity to see my daughter walk for the first time (among many of her other firsts)!”—Alyssa A. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“I'm immunodeficient, and quarantine has been a godsend for me. The extra sanitization and screening procedures, wearing masks, and people washing their hands have all helped me to NOT be sick for the first time in DECADES.” —Kelly W. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“I've fallen in love all over again with my Covid lockdown partner, my wife of 30+ years.”—Terry F. (Editor's note: <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/loudly-crying-face_1f62d.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/loudly-crying-face_1f62d.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/loudly-crying-face_1f62d.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“I took 9 strokes off my USGA handicap!”—Adrian K. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"I've learned I can experience the same amount of joy from walking in my local neighborhood as visiting grand marvels like the Grand Canyon. More importantly, I have befriended a cardinal named Roy. He stares into my soul daily looking through my window when I am WFH."—Taylor R.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"Losing a job I hated brought me to a job I love where I am valued more than I thought imaginable in a career.”—Jacob S. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks for sending in your good vibes. They filled our Tuesday with the best kind of slow-spreading smiles.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

</div>

collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRiding a wave of good vibes, the Dow Jones Industrial Average \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/dow-hits-30000-on-vaccine-progress-biden-transition-idUSKBN2841OS?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erallied\u003c/a\u003e past 29,972 points yesterday to a record high. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt also topped 30,000, another completely arbitrary number. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuick refresher on the Dow:\u003c/strong\u003e It’s a collection of 30 \"blue-chip\" U.S. stocks. Blue chip = big, established companies like Microsoft, JPMorgan, Disney, and McDonald's. It’s often criticized for a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/19/markets-101-read-stock-indexes-securities?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efunky weighting system\u003c/a\u003e and a small sample size (the S\u0026P has more than 500 companies), but the 124-year-old index still holds a symbolic grip over Wall Street. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd that’s exactly how professional investors view the Dow at 30k: symbolic, nothing more. The number could get some individual investors excited, but from a technical POV, it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-dow30000-psychology-analys/analysis-dow-cracks-30000-a-psychological-boost-during-a-pandemic-idUSKBN2842OJ?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust another data point\u003c/a\u003e within the broader market rally.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s talk about that rally \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it started: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Dow was \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/global-stock-markets-dow-update-11-24-2020-11606213552?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein the dumps\u003c/a\u003e during the onset of the pandemic, trading below 19,000 points in March. Industries such as energy, travel, and banking—all of which are featured prominently in the Dow—were crushed disproportionately due to the lockdowns.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow it’s going: \u003c/strong\u003eThose beaten-down industries are enjoying a renaissance thanks to what Bloomberg calls the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-24/back-to-normal-rally-drives-dow-above-30-000-for-first-time?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eback-to-normal\u003c/a\u003e” rally. Skyrocketing tech stocks (like Zoom and Peloton) are taking a breather while names like Boeing and AMC are mounting a comeback. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat’s driving the back-to-normal rally? It’s likely the confluence of several developments: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNews that an effective vaccine(s) could be rolled out in weeks\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUncertainty around the election result fading away following President Trump’s legal setbacks \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExpectations that President-elect Joe Biden, and his Treasury Secretary nominee Janet Yellen, will push for more economic stimulus\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe more you know: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Dow hit 10,000 for the first time in March 1999, and touched 20,000 in January 2017. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, spice aisle mainstay McCormick decided to do what you do when the eggs come out a little rubbery: add Cholula. It \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/mccormick-nears-deal-to-buy-hot-sauce-maker-cholula-11606188600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagreed to buy\u003c/a\u003e the wood-capped hot sauce company’s parent from private equity firm L Catterton for $800 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMcCormick’s POV: \u003c/strong\u003eCholula will add to a spicy category within the food giant’s slate of offerings. Hot sauce sales in the U.S. are projected to near $1 billion this year, per Euromonitor, approaching ketchup’s throne. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMcCormick has had a buttery, delicious year, with a major shift toward at-home cooking boosting sales of its grocery products, which include French’s mustard, Old Bay seasoning, and Frank’s RedHot. Others in the sector such as Kellogg have also seen higher sales numbers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMcCormick \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/24/business/cholula-acquisition/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that with Frank’s and Cholula, it’ll command about 30% of the U.S. hot sauce market. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCholula’s POV: \u003c/strong\u003eMcCormick said it would help Cholula boost e-comm sales, improve distribution, and strengthen its restaurant biz. DYK? Forty percent of consumers discover Cholula at restaurants. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for Cholula’s previous owner, L Catterton is reportedly expecting a 4x return on its 2019 purchase of Cholula. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs hundreds of thousands of college students trek home for Thanksgiving, public health experts hope Zoom burnout and dirty laundry are all they bring back. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUniversities are taking extra precautions:\u003c/strong\u003e Many are \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/education/thanksgiving-coronavirus-campus-university-wisconsin-madison/2020/11/20/9b2c68c0-2a07-11eb-92b7-6ef17b3fe3b4_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eending\u003c/a\u003e in-person instruction this week and will wrap the semester up virtually. Some are \u003ca href=\"https://www.mlive.com/news/ann-arbor/2020/11/university-of-michigan-urges-students-not-to-return-to-campus-for-winter-semester.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eencouraging students\u003c/a\u003e to stay home through the extended winter break.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe American College Health Association advised schools with in-person classes after Thanksgiving to ask students to remain on campus.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e A great migration of asymptomatic college students could worsen the U.S.’ Covid-19 caseloads. In the last week, new cases averaged 173,165 per day. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s it mean for spring semester? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany colleges are expected to stick with virtual or hybrid learning, but we could see more human bodies on college campuses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Princeton \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-24/princeton-says-all-undergrads-can-return-to-campus-in-february?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvited\u003c/a\u003e all undergrads to campus in January, though most instruction will remain virtual. And the University of Alabama is \u003ca href=\"https://www.al.com/news/2020/11/university-of-alabama-considers-requiring-all-staff-students-to-return-to-campus-in-january.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econsidering\u003c/a\u003e requiring all students and staff to return full-time unless they have a style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Recording Academy \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/skbaer/2021-grammy-awards-nominations?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e this year’s roster of Grammy nominees. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe highlights: \u003c/strong\u003eObscure indie vocalist Beyoncé notched nine nominations in eight categories, and Taylor Swift scored six. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDua Lipa, former Alabama Shakes frontwoman Brittany Howard, Billie Eilish, Megan Thee Stallion, and DaBaby could also take home some hardware in January. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe snubs:\u003c/strong\u003e The Academy \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/24/arts/music/grammy-awards-nominations.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill thinks\u003c/a\u003e of The Weeknd as Saturday and Sunday, even though the pop star will perform at the Super Bowl. Country star Luke Combs isn’t on the nominee list, either. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eMany artists are still scrambling to recover from the broad cancellation of live performances prompted by social distancing restrictions. In the first half of 2020, streaming music grew to 85% of the market by value, compared with 80% the prior year, \u003ca href=\"http://riaa.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Mid-Year-2020-RIAA-Revenue-Statistics.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper\u003c/a\u003e the Recording Industry Association of America. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003e.plans for the Jan. 31 ceremony are murky, though we know late-nighter Trevor Noah will host. A few of our favorites: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Working from home almost 100% has provided me the opportunity to see my daughter walk for the first time (among many of her other firsts)!”—Alyssa A. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“I'm immunodeficient, and quarantine has been a godsend for me.
